page.title: 05Bird life on Lundy.
page.content: Most of the bird life is past the Quarter Wall and Pondsbury and to the N.of the island away from the village. There have been 425 species recorded on and around the island. There are three bird traps for catching and ringing birds, Pondsbury has a mist net and there are others at the halfway wall and the quarries.The number of nesting birds is declining for many reasons. The loss of Gannets was blamed on the introdution of the fog-horn at the North Lighthouse.Marine paints and effluents pollute the sea and kill the fish,so the adults and chicks die from poisoning. The introduction of drag nets has taken too many fish from the sea so the chicks starve.Warm currents have moved away from Lundy,taking with them Sand Eels and small fish. {Ben Rainger.}
